metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20807 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Vim before 8.1.0881, users can circumvent the rvim restricted mode and execute arbitrary OS commands via scripting interfaces (e.g., Python, Ruby, or Lua).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20807` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-athena - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-common - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-gtk - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-gui-common - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-nox - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-runtime - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-tiny - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
xxd - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5').
